Good luck!

This afternoon, Governor Pritzker announced that in-person instruction for all schools in Illinois is cancelled for the rest of this school year.

At Streator High School, we will continue with E-learning and will have more details and announcements for you early next week as we are able to iron out some details regarding the end of the school year.

That being said, please keep in mind that all work is continuing to be graded. Grades cannot be lowered by work done during remote/E-learning, however, please be advised that doing NO work or doing insignificant amounts of work for your classes may result in receiving INCOMPLETES for the 4th quarter or the semester. An "incomplete" in a class on your transcript means that you DO NOT receive credit for that particular class (it would be similar to receiving an F as a grade).

If you have questions regarding your current status in each class, please reach out to your teachers who are available on weekdays from 9am-2pm.

Hello students!

As of today, we are still continuing with E-Learning/remote learning through April 30th and will let you know if that changes.

I want to remind all of you that work is expected to be completed for all of your classes during remote learning days. Streator High School is a Unified Champion School, which means we believe that our school would be better if all people were valued, respected, embraced, and included. This week is Respect Week at SHS. Through our Unified Bulldogs group, we will have activities, dress days, and a pledge day to promote inclusion this week.

Monday: Random Acts of Kindness Day.
Tuesday: Spirit Wear Day/ Wear BLUE to show RESPECT
